raw_text:
Budget Aston takes on Porsche
 
 British car maker Aston Martin has gone head-to-head with Porsche's 911 sports cars with the launch of its cheapest model yet.
 
 With a price tag under £80,000, the V8 Vantage is tens of thousands of pounds cheaper than existing Aston models. The Vantage is "the most important car in the history of our company", said Aston's chief executive Ulrich Bez. Aston - whose cars were famously used by James Bond - will unveil the Vantage at the Geneva Motor Show on Thursday. Mr Bez - himself a former executive at rival Porsche - said the new car was the company's "most affordable car ever and makes the brand accessible". This in turn would make Aston Martin "globally visible, but still very, very exclusive", he added.
 
 First shown as a concept car at the 2003 North American International Auto Show in Detroit, the V8 Vantage will be available in the UK in late summer. Development costs for the Vantage have been kept low by sharing a platform with Aston's DB9, which Mr Bez described as "the previous most important car for our company". There is currently an 18 months waiting list for the DB9, Mr Bez said. The Vantage will be built at the new Aston factory in Gaydon, near Warwick, and should more than double Aston's total output from about 2,000 presently.
llama3.2:1b: Aston Martin has launched its cheapest model yet, the V8 Vantage, priced under £80,000.
It is described as "the most important car in the history of our company" by CEO Ulrich Bez and will be unveiled at the Geneva Motor Show.
The new car makes Aston Martin accessible to a wider audience while maintaining exclusivity due to its development costs.

The car was previously shown as a concept in 2003 and will be built at Aston's new factory near Warwick.
It is expected to double the company's total output and make Aston Martin more globally visible while remaining exclusive.

qwen2.5:0.5b: Aston Martin has launched its cheapest Aston Martin car - a V8 Vantage priced under £80,000, which is "the most important car in the history of our company" according to chief executive Ulrich Bez and will be unveiled at the Geneva Motor Show.
It's considered an "accessible" model with a price tag that exceeds current Aston Martin models by tens of thousands of pounds.
The Vantage is expected to make the brand more globally visible but still offer exclusivity, as it was compared to Porsche's 911 sports cars.
Development costs have been kept low with Volkswagen Group's DB9 platform shared with Aston Martin's DB9 car, and there is an 18-month waiting list for the Vantage production vehicle.
qwen2.5:1.5b: British carmaker Aston Martin launches its most affordable model yet, priced under £80,000 for a V8 Vantage sports car with plans to unveil it at the Geneva Motor Show in late summer, making it globally accessible but exclusive due to low development costs sharing a platform with Aston's DB9.

Chief executive Ulrich Bez considers this the most important car in Aston's history and will debut at the Geneva Motor Show on Thursday.
The new V8 Vantage is based on a shared platform with Aston's DB9, which has an 18-month waiting list.

Expected to be available in the UK by late summer, the V8 Vantage will more than double Aston Martin's current production capacity and aims to make the brand globally visible while maintaining exclusivity.

opencoder:1.5b: "The V8 Vantage is a luxury car priced below average with a budget that may yet make it the cheapest car of its time.

Developed by the Aston group as a concept car in Detroit, France, and unveiled at the 2003 North American International Auto Show in the UK, this model will remain on the cutting edge of automotive innovation despite its price tag."
smollm:1.7b: The summary above is concise and to the point, preserving key ideas and details while omitting unnecessary information.

The main points of the text are:

1.
Budget Aston takes on Porsche: British car maker Aston Martin has gone head-to-head with Porsche's 911 sports cars with the launch of its cheapest model yet.

Tens of thousands of pounds cheaper than existing Aston models: The V8 Vantage is "the most important car in the history of our company" and "tens of thousands of pounds cheaper than existing Aston models".
Launch at Geneva Motor Show: The Vantage will be unveiled at the Geneva Motor Show on Thursday, with Mr Bez saying it was the company's "most affordable car ever and makes the brand accessible".

First shown as a concept car at North American International Auto Show: The V8 Vantage will be available in the UK in late summer, with development costs kept low by sharing a platform with Aston's DB9.
There is currently an 18-month waiting list for the DB9, Mr Bez said.
Increase in output from about 2,000: The V8 Vantage should more than double Aston's total output from about 2,000 presently.
deepseek-r1:1.5b: Aston Martin has introduced the V8 Vantage, a budget-friendly sports car with a price tag under £80,000, cheaper than existing models by tens of thousands.
Known as "the most important car in our history," it was unveiled at the Geneva Motor Show and will be available in the UK later.
The car is being produced by sharing a platform with the DB9, which has an 18-month waiting list for production.
tinyllama:1.1b: The British car manufacturer Aston Martin has introduced its cheapest model yet with the launch of the VanTagge, which is set to be the most affordable vehicle in their lineup.

The new car will be unveiled at the Geneva Motor Show on Thursday and marks a significant step forward for the brand, which will now become globally visible but still remain highly exclusive thanks to its low development costs.
First introduced as a concept car in 2003 as part of an overhaul of their lineup, the VanTagge's focus is to bring Aston Martin "into the global spotlight" while remaining "very, very exclusive".
Its affordability will allow it to be delivered at a waitlisting of about two years for the DB9, the most significant model in Aston's history.
The VanTagge, which has been designed with input from Porsche, will be built at the new Aston factory near Warwick, creating a total output of 2,000 units.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Aston Martin, a British car manufacturer, has made significant changes to their vehicles with the launch of the V8 Vantage, which will be available in the UK in late summer at a significantly lower price than its predecessor.
This change aims to make the brand more accessible and global visibility while keeping development costs low by sharing a platform with the Aston's DB9 model.
The Vantage is "the most important car in the history of our company," according to its CEO, Ulrich Bez.
With its new lower price point, consumers can afford a luxury sports car without having to compromise on performance or quality.
